column2: Text

(atb) returned to atl due to gear disagree message during gear-up selection with an associated gear warning light.  crewcompleted qrh procedure and declared an emergency with atc.  gear extension resulted in normal gear down indication.  replaced gear operated sequence valve, leak and op cks good.nature of condition:  warning indicationprecautionary procedure:  nonepart name: sequence valvepart condition: malfunctioned

after gear retraction, left gear disagree light remained illuminated then intermittent, all gear appeared and felt to beretracted. returned to departure.   r & r the target assembly iaw mm.nature of condition:  false warningprecautionary procedure:  unsched landingpart name: targetpart condition: faulted

after t/o, heard a loud sound as the gear was  raised. during the after t/o flow, fo(p.m.) pointed  out the left main ge ar lt was showing red. the  config synoptic also showed  red for the left gear.  followed the qrh and brought the gear d own - all  green. raising the gear again per qrh lead back to  all red lts for the left main. consulted mx over  satcom  and elected to return kind on approach, as  a/c slowed to 200k, gear unsafe lt extinguished.  continued approach to unev entful landing.  shgn 01may21 13:59   ind u  after a/c returned to gate, the left main gear door  dropped, once hyd pres sure was removed. upon  performing the gvi of the left gear area, found  door cracked around the entire perimeter of whe

after takeoff msgs lt mlg gear disagree gear doors eicas cpt reported that the nose and r/mlg showed up and lock. the le ft did not show up and lock. ac taxi in with left mlg door down only, red unsafe lt illuminated. initial inspection foun d the ldg gr door close c/b on the p34 tripped every time and mlg doors would not close. troubleshot per wdm 32-35-11 an d found the left mlg door safety valve at fault. r&r lt mlg door safety valve per amm 32-35-10, ops and panel open. clos ed c/b and jacked a/c to perform gear swing. c/b rotable parts change was indicated - tt 1365204  sn off 0039 valve, mlg , saf off 64-3235-9-9002 0039 on 64-3235-9-9002 0049 leak ck good. performed multiple gear swings, all cks good.

after takeoff,  after gear retraction, the nose landing gear red unsafe light came on,  followed by a rubber burning odo r.  red light would stay on a few minutes and go off, then come back on until landing.  declared an emergency and return ed to departure without further incident.  landed with three green and under max landing weight. after normal landing,   maintenance installed all three gear pins from aircraft.  maintenance replaced d1-32 nose gear locked sensor iaw amm 32- 60-05, and nose gear locked wiring harness iaw swpm 20-61-00.  also, due to odor in the cabin after take off,  removed a nd replaced the lt pressure regulator valve iaw amm 21-31-01.  aircraft was grounded.

airborne return due to gear/gear door malfunction emergency declaration after takeoff gear did not indicate fully retrac ted gear door amber open light and right main red gear light complied with qrh emergency declared returned to atl. inspe cted and found rt main landing gear follow up torque tube assy damaged also found skids damaged on both lt and rt inboar d doors damaged inboard gear doors transferred to nr 001 and nr 002 dated 04 mar 19 removed and replaced follow up torqu e tube assembly for rt main landing gear replaced iaw amm 32-31 needs ops check rigged torque tube push pull cables per  amm 32-31-00 page block 501 301 5 l and r sides completed adjustment of torque tube push-pull cables per md 88 amm 32-31

aircraft rejected take off at 110 knots, due to fwd entry door light turned on. maintenance personnel performed revisiondetecting the mlg tires numbers 3 and 4 that begin to deflate; so the mlg wheel numbers 3 and 4 were replaced iaw amm 32-45-11. aircraft was sent to the hangar and the mlg wheel, tire and brakes were replaced iaw amm 32-45-11; the fim 52-10 task 801 procedure was performed, no damages were detected in sensor s199 and sw s1147; bite to pseu iaw amm 53-00-00,no confirming failure. high energy stop inspection was performed iaw mm 05-51-07, no damages were found, all correct.nature of condition:  warning indicationprecautionary procedure:  aborted takeoffpart name: tirepart condition: deflated

aircraft rejected takeoff at 100 knots due to an event of 1023 degrees celsius of egts exceedance in the felt engine andby notification of the air traffic control of fire evidence in the rt mlg.  the acft was sent to hangar and maintenancepersonnel performed an inspection on the lt engine iaw amm 71-00-00, egt exceedance limits fig 603, sheet 2 and the approved pcr issued by engine mfg, being within limits.  the high energy stop, heat damage, brake fire was performed iaw amm 05-51-14 step d, detecting apparent evidence of over temperature of the mlg brake, wheel and tire assy nr 4.  the mlgbrake, wheel and tire assy nr 4 were replaced iaw amm 32-45-07 and amm 32-45-01.  the nrc?s a0237216, a0237220 and a023nature of condition:  warning indication, flame/fireprecautionary procedure:  aborted takeoffpart name: brake assypart condition: overheated

aircraft was grounded.  emergency declared.  landing uneventful.  during approach the landing gear handle stuck in the up position.  numerous attempts were required to place it in the down position.  gear extended successfully.  maintenanceremoved and replaced the landing gear control lever module assembly iaw amm 32-31-11 and accomplished successful landing gear control system test iaw amm 32-31-00.nature of condition:  otherprecautionary procedure:  otherpart name: control modulepart condition: sticking

aircraft was grounded.  experienced gear related vibration above 100 kts on t/o and landing.  upon taxi in, experienced  second left main failure-both left gear tires flat reported by another a/c.  flight crew also reported aproximatley 30 m inutes after sitting with the left main gear tires flat they experienced a loss of hydraulic quantity on the left hand s ide.  maintenance main found the hydraulic line to the left gear shimmy damper severed.  maintenance replaced the severe d hydraulic line, bled the shimmy damper and accomplished a satisfactory leak check, per amm 32-11-81.  (aala20201112902 2) in addition, left hand main landing gear nr 1 (aala202011019005) and nr 2 (aala202011129021) tires were replaced, per

aircraft was grounded: flight took off, engine indication and crew alerting system hydraulic loss. emergency declared du e to the complete loss of the center hydraulic system. the first indication received was a flap primary failure, then ce nter hydraulic loss. the nose gear retracted after takeoff, but main gear would not retract. flight dumped 134,000 pound s of fuel to get under maximum landing weight. flight returned to pvg and landed without further incident. maintenance f ound lefthand main landing gear truck position actuator pressure line fitting and pressure hose broken, c2 pump pressure  line broken. maintenance replaced the fitting as per amm 32-32-14 and pressure hose (see aala201805219019) with alterna

aircraft was grounded: on landing rollout crew felt a heavy shimmy with uncontrollable steering which resulted in the fa ilure of the nose landing gear steering system.  an emergency was declared.  maintenance performed a preliminary evaluat ion of the nose gear wheel sterring assembly and discovered the center apex pin for the torsion links was broken and had  caused the torsion links to disconnect at the center attach point which caused the loss of steering of the nose landing  gear.  **supplemental report: replaced broken torsion link apex pin, installed new upper and lower torsion links and ac complished a satisfactory operational check per amm 32-21-31.**(closed)

all 3 red ldg gear light on with all 3 green also and 3 green  o vhd panel went to hold  did qrh 7-45399-3 shows 1 avail able ewr if needed. locked due to emergency declared locked per tomc sm . unlocked for update debriefed crew cycled gear  handle and checked landing gear performed fim task task 32-30-00-810-816.found gear lever stiff manual door for debris  no debris closed door. crew did a go and not going into detent consistently giving reported around cycled landing gear d oor. three green on forward panel discrepancy. suggest replacement of lever module  p/n 273a3301-8 and three red at four  hundred feet, nis ewr. and perform teleflex cable push pull test. cable p/n removed landing gear lever iaw amm task 32-

atb - after t/o tail skid eicas msg came on after gear retraction. accomplished qrh procedure for tailskid msg and tailstrike were accomplished heavyweight landing made. gw 373720. descent rate at touchdown was less than 200 fpm. normal landing accomplished. t/s per fim 32-71-00. found damaged 28vdc wire at connector reterminated wires at connector for tailskid per bspm 20-00-00 item cleared.nature of condition:  false warningprecautionary procedure:  nonepart name: wirepart condition: damaged

captain reported high vibration during takeoff in mex on the left inboard / outboard main landing gear. at cun, maintena nce personnel performed the tire tread loss or tire burst conditional inspection iaw amm 05-51-54 and ground handling eq uipment hits airplane or part departs airplane conditional inspection iaw amm 05-51-59, detecting mlg wheel and tire pos ition 02 with thrown tread and damages on left flap inboard induced by mlg wheel and tire position 02. the wo?s 5443578,  5443224 and 5443356 were issued to repair the damages detected. the mlg wheel and tire positions 01 and 02 were replace d iaw amm 32-45-11 and left wing aft flap inboard was replaced iaw amm task 27-51-12-000-801 and amm 27-51-12, tested co

captain reported that during landing, the control tower informed that excessive smoke was observed in the lt mlg.  mx was informed by gnd personnel that lt mlg tire was flatted, so the flat spotted tires conditional inspection was perform iaw amm 05-51-16-210-801, detecting the lt mlg tire nr 2, brake nr 1 & hyd hose damaged, so the non-routine card nrs a0223537 & a0223538 were issued for correction of discrepancies & the accu was reviewed detecting the failure code box 1 - 4.  the hyd hose was replaced iaw amm 32-40-11, the main wheel assembly nr 001 & 002 were replaced iaw amm 32-45-11, thebrakes assembly nrs 001 & 002 were replaced iaw amm 32-41-41, the anti-skid control vlv & the anti-skid auto brake contrnature of condition:  smoke/fumes/odors/sparksprecautionary procedure:  nonepart name: control valvepart condition: failed

discrepancy:  at 2300z at fl240 a loud noise was heard followed by the illumination of the nose gear red light and a vib ration after the nose gear and main landing gear green and red light came on.  declared an emergency with miami and requ ested emergency vehicles.  landed safely, fire truck inspected, the a/c taxied to gate.  corrective action:  performed i nspections of all three landing gear iaw amm 05-51-47 and 32-13-00.  found missing bushing at left hand outer aft attach  bolt.  installed missing bushing iaw amm 32-13-21.  performed landing gear sensor inspection and test iaw amm 32-09-00  and 32-08-02, all normal.  performed landing gear lever switch inspection and check iaw amm 32-61-11, no discrepancy not

during takeoff,  landing gear would not retract.  lost auto-throttles, speeds, flight director, auto pilot.  f/o retracted gear using lock override.made  decision to return.also lost cabin alt,tat  probe,transponder would not indentify to atc.eicas  messages"cabin alt auto 2,warn elex,nose a/g  disagree,air/gnd disagree,tat probe,no  autobrakes,no speed brakes.  check found the status msg:capt pitot heat,l aux pitot heat ,air/gnd disagree,   nose a/g disagree,cabin alt auto 2,reset power of the a/c, only status msg:air/gnd   disagree,nose a/g disagree.also performed bite of pseu, no fault codefound. t/s   check found the nose gear compressed prox sensor (s10068) broken. sensor   replaced. during swing check, tnature of condition:  false warningprecautionary procedure:  unsched landingpart name: sensorpart condition: damaged

gear disagree / gear doors after handle raised. found right gear forward drag strut actuator rod end pulled out of shaft .  inspected area surrounding   act. for damage.  none noted.  checked brake anti rotation rod bolts on all main brakes.    all checked good.   removed and replaced rh mlg fwd gear lock actuator  iaw amm 32-32-02-4. leak and ops checks good.

gear disagree eicas msg. gear door caution msg. with nose gear indication showing hashed. maintenance message 32-51001.  flight crew belive nlg did not retract when commanded. aircraft subsequently dumped fuel and returned to lhr.

gear disagree message, left main did not retract after take off.  emergency declared. complied with fim 32-30-00-815-840-001 and found side brace lock actuator rod end pulled from actuator piston.  removed & replaced the side brace lock actuator on lt mlg iaw mm 32-32-02. ops checked good, no leaks noted.  swung gear iaw 32-32-00. ops normal.nature of condition:  warning indicationprecautionary procedure:  unsched landingpart name: rod endpart condition: failed

gear would not retract after takeoff per conversation with flight crew all systems showed aircraft as air return to the  gate ,  during debrief the crew reports gear not leaving the ground. acars never registered off ground times. level woul d not  move from the off position with several gear handle would not move past off position. attempts, captain also note d that acars did not report aircraft off the ground. electrical compt, none noted. 32-31-11,  had 28v at pin 4 of d232 b ut no ground at pin 3 with aircraft on jacks in the air mode. performed check on pseu on channels 503 and 504 for landin g gear on return to gate found no c/b''''s out/popped on either p11 or p6 when pseu was first tested,  had faults 012 and

on approach to runway 27 kmem, when landing gear  selected down, the left gear down green light did not illuminate. decl ared an emergency with kmem atc, made low pass to allow tower to visually  verify all gear normal. normal landing after   verifying gear down with tower. upon crew debrief found that the lt gear down switch light was burned out and would not  test. relamped lt gear down locked light iaw amm  33-13-00-2. light illuminated and ops checked good. as precaution vis ually inspected down lock sensors on main and nose gear, also performed bite test of  pseu and found no discrepancies ia w fim 32-09 ft804 fig 103. a/c has no 30 day history and is ok to continue service at this time.

on final approach placed the gear handle to down  position. received gear  disagree eicas. rt gear did not extend. accomplished alt gear ext chklst. right gear came down  normally. found nr 7 tire blewout cause damage of hydraulic lines near ceiling are above rt main landing gear. found r gear tilt pressure switch cannon plug broken. removed and replaced canon plug d3208 iaw swpm 20-61-11. removed and replaced 3 ea hydraulic lines that were damaged ipc ref 32-32-51-16 items 680,550, and 705. no other broken or damaged lines noted upon close inspection. perform main landing gear extension and retraction chk, ref amm 33-32-00 and ecra 3232-01115 ops chk good no fault noted.nature of condition:  warning indication, affect systemsprecautionary procedure:  aborted approachpart name: tirepart condition: blown

on final, selected gear down and received three greens. selected the gear handle up both mains went up and nose stayed down. received a gear disagree message,   on second final, selected gear down all three gear came down and three green.jacked aircraft iaw amm 07-11-01.  several circuit breakers pulled and collared for jacking iaw amm 32-09-02. wip 593093. cycled all gear up & down, all ops normal.  pinned mlg ran nose 10 times checked gear door actuator & gear retract actuator for overheat.  bypass. system ops normal & no overheat.  replaced the extend-retract actuator iaw amm 32-34.  removed and installed the nlg lock actuator, leak & ops checked iaw  amm 32-42-02.  performed ops test of mlg ext/ret iaw amnature of condition:  warning indicationprecautionary procedure:  aborted approachpart name: landing gearpart condition: malfunctioned

on gear up, an eicas  disagree,  ran qrh to three green no other messages,  and landed.  inspected the gear assembly.  f ound the nr 2 brake rod assembly broken in half and missing forward portion and brake pin assembly.  brake rotation with  hard line broken.   removed and replaced brake rod assembly iaw amm 32-11-20, and 32-41-06.  installed a new brake rod  pin iaw amm 32-11-20.  removed and replaced the nr 2 brake hose assembly iaw  amm 32-41-16. ops checked good, leak check ed good.

pdis  787     32-60  2346     13dec17  cae  open  u  logpages:2251493  during climbout upon landing gear retraction (l/ghandle in "up" position) received "gear disagree"  eicas msg with associated "gear" discrete lt.  complied with qrh. at 5000 ft, 210 kias cycled l/g  down then up, no eicas, no unsafe indications.  removed & replaced nose gear retract actuator in                                  ref with fdx b757 amm 32-34-01-4. op`s & leakchecked good. op`s & leak of nose gear lock                                       actuator good also in ref with b757 amm 32-34-02-4.                               time checks of extension & retraction stillnature of condition:  warning indicationprecautionary procedure:  otherpart name: actuatorpart condition: inoperative

performed an air turn back due to crew reporting unable to retract left main landing gear with associated gear door and  gear disagree indications.  maintenance found a failed left main landing gear side brace actuator. replaced the actuator  and ops checked the landing gear, found  normal.

ship 1813 - atb - returned to jfki due to gear disagree and gear door eicas messages appeared after takeoff. complied wi th checklist, put the gear down and all indicators normal corrective action- replaced rt mlg restrictor valve and rt mlg  door safety valve. performed gear swing.

upon landing with main wheels on the gnd & prior to nose wheel touching gnd, experienced excessive shimmy.  several ceiling panel came down, 2 psu fell down & latches broke & two video monitor fell down & latches broke.  complied with amm 05-51-08-210-802, inspection 05-51-01-210-801.  r & r lt shimmy damper & bleed both iaw amm 32-11-81-401.  during mlg shimmy inspection, position of lt mlg torque link tapered sleeve & straight sleeve found to be reversed.  sleeves installedin correct position iaw amm 32-11-81-400-801.  sleeves, bushings & pin inspected ok.nature of condition:  vibration/buffetprecautionary procedure:  nonepart name: shimmy dampenerpart condition: unserviceable

placed landing gear handle down, had three red landing gear lights and gear door open light. performed alternate gear extension iaw qrh. was unable to stow alternate gear handle. landed with gear doors open. cw adj ck of alt. landing gear external ref md90 amm 32-31. rig pins r28, r29 fit good. insp alt gear handle lock release link, no trouble noted. verified rig p inertial navigation system r-26, r27 fit smooth for land gear control valve to landing gear handle. ops ck landing gear several times and indicator ations all normal. repalced left right main landing gear door skids. inspected landing gear selector - handle linkage for condition. all satisfactory. replaced landing gear switch per md90 amm 32-63. fails alternate gear extend procedure, nose gear does no

performed an air turn back due to crew reporting unable to retract left main landing gear with associated gear door and gear disagree indications. maintenance found a failed left main landing gear side brace actuator. replaced the actuator and operation check the landing gear, found normal.

on final, selected gear down and received three greens. selected the gear handle up both mains went up and nose stayed down. received a gear disagree message, on second final, selected gear down all three gear came down and three green. several circuit circuit-breaker pulled and collared for jacking iaw amm 32-09-02. wip 593093. cycled all gear up & down, all ops normal. pinned main landing gear ran nose 10 times checked gear door actuator & gear retract actuator for overheat. bypass. system ops normal & no overheat. replaced the extend retract actuator iaw amm 32-34. removed and installed the nose landing gear lock actuator, leak & operation check iaw amm 32-42-02. performed ops test of main landing gear external ret iaw am nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : aborted approach part name : landing gear part condition : malfunctioned

lt gear unsafe light illuminated with the landing gear retracted. when the crew lowered the gear received 3 down and lo cked green indications. an emergency was declared for the return to departure. maintenance rigged both of the main landing gear door actuators, both of the main landing gear door latches, and adjusted both the main landing gear uplock sensors. operation check good and the aircraft has returned to service.

emergency declared. flight returned to departure due to a main landing gear indication. uneventful landing. removedand replaced main landing gear door closed sensors ; s10241 right main landing gear system 1, s10242 left main landing gear system 1, and s10072 right main landing gear system 2 iaw amm 32-61-02. operational checked good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : sensor part condition : faulty

emergency declared. flight returned to departure due to a main landing gear indication. uneventful landing. removedand replaced main landing gear door closed sensors s10241, right main landing gear system 1, s10242 left main landing gear system 1, and s10072 right main landing gear system 2, iaw amm 32-61-02. operational checked good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : sensor part condition : faulty

aircrat was grounded, landing gear would not retract, crew confirmed manual extension door was closed and cycled gear handle and landing gears retracted. aircraft returned to departure, landed safely without further incident. no emergency was declared. removed, and replaced the landing gear control lever module and accomplished landing gear swing.
aircraft landed with left main landing gear retracted at lax

emergency declared. mia uvf flight returned to mia account main landing gear indication. uneventful landing. removedand replaced main landing gear door closed sensors ; s10241 right main landing gear system, s10242 left main landing gear system 1, and s10072 right main landing gear system 2 iaw amm 32-61-02. operational checked good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : sensor part condition : faulty

aircraft not grounded : after takeoff and landing gear retracted - in the process of placing the landing gear handle in the off postion the red landing gear in transit lts illuminated and the gear began to extend. placed gear handle to up posistion before the gear fully exten erd max speed during the event was 250kts. performed inspection iaw mm 055147, no damage found. ok for service.

ship 1813 - air turn back - returned to jf ki due to gear disagree and gear door eicas messages appeared after takeoff. complied with checklist, put the gear down and all indicators normal corrective action - replaced right main landing gear restrictor valve and right main landing gear door safety valve. performed gear swing.

after the gear was raised after takeoff, a red right gear light-remained illuminated. on return to landing, all gear left ights indicated green with handle lowered. aircraft grounded. air turn back. removed and replaced the right main landing gear uplock actuator iaw amm 32-32-41. accomplished main landing gear uplock actuator leak test for right main landing gear. operation check good iaw amm 32 - 32-40-400-801, step 3g no leaks noted.

after takeoff msgs lt main landing gear gear disagree gear doors eicas cpt reported that the nose and right main landing gear showed up and lock. the leading edge ft did not show up and lock. ac taxi in with left main landing gear door down only, red unsafe lt illuminated. initial inspection found the landing gr door close circuit-breaker on the p34 tripped every time and main landing gear doors would not close. troubleshot per wdm 32-35-11 and found the left main landing gear door safety valve at fault. right & right lt main landing gear door safety valve per amm 32-35-10, ops and panel open. closed circuit-breaker and jacked aircraft to perform gear swing. circuit-breaker rotable parts change was indicated - tt 1365204 sn off 0039 valve, main landing gear, saf off 64-3235-9-9002 0039 on 64-3235-9-9002 0049 leak ck good. performed multiple gear swings, all cks good.

gear disagree eicas message. noted by flight crew that nose gear indication remained dashed out. nose landing gear never indicated up. replaced door operated sequence valve, gear operated sequence valve, primary lock sensor, and nose landing gear retract actuator. performed landing retraction test. all tests passed. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : actuator part condition : failed

on gear extension, lt main landing gear remained red and left gear light on upper panel was off. during, and leaving gear down, the left green light came on when applying some positive g-force. removed and replaced left main landing gear downlock actuator iaw amm 32-32-51. operational checked good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : actuator part condition : faulty

landing gear unsafe. gear handle up. left gear unsafe in up position. ran qrh gear door light did not extinguish upon lo wering gear. completed procedure and landed in atl. no further issues. ran alternate gear extend performed per qrh. cw no go odi prevention main gear indication. found lt main landing gear door uplock arm loose. resecured adjustment ops ck good. replaced lt & right main landing gear door rubstrips. performed gear swing ops ck good. ok for service. ( lp5772912 )

sup - air turn back left gear indication remaining red with gear handle up. checked lt main landing gear up and latched per amm 32-6 1-00-820-804 checked good and sensor readed checked ok. removed and replaced lt main landing gear retract cylinder per amm 32-33-01, left eak and ops ck pending. removed and replaced main landing gear bungee per amm 321-33-02. leak and operation check pending ops and leak check good, ok for service. found lower brace link frozen to main landing gear strut. removed lower brace link per amm 32-13 - 05-000-801. found lower brace link grease passage clogged. installed lt main landing gear lower brace link per amm 32-13-05 ops and leak ok, also accomplished ops and leak check of main landing gear retract cylinder per amm 32-33-01 only ok for service.

pdis 787 32-60 2346 13dec17 cae open u log pages : 2251493 during climbout upon landing gear retraction ( landing gear handle in " up " position ) received " gear disagree " eicas message with associated " gear " discrete lt. complied with qrh. at 5000 ft, 210 knots indicated air speed cycled landing gear down then up, no eicas, no unsafe indications. removed & replaced nose gear retract actuator in ref with fdx b757 amm 32-34-01-4. op `s & leak checked good. op `s & leak of nose gear lock actuator good also in ref with b757 amm 32-34-02-4. time checks of extension & retraction still nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : actuator part condition : inoperative

after takeoff, received lt lg main gear unsafe indication on primary and secondary gear retraction gear indication. ran qrh, gear primary or secondary lights illuminated w gear handle up checklist. lt main gear unsafe indication remained illuminated. dumped approximately 8500 lbs of fuel. diverted to klax after gear selected down for landing, received 3 green down & left ocked indications w no unsafe. emergency declared. checked landing gear door targets per amm 32-10-00-5. adjusted as needed. removed and replaced lt main gear retract cylinder per amm 32-31-01-4. operation check good removed and replaced lt main landing gear door actuator per amm 32-34-01-2. operation check and leak checks good.

landing gear disagree light inbound. when gear handle was put to off, gear disagree light went out and stayed out when handle was put back to up. removed and replaced nose landing gear lock actuator and lock actuator bolt iaw amm 32-34-02. adjusted the gaps on the nose landing gear uplock & downlock sensors iaw amm 32-61-03. operation check good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : none part name : bolt part condition : damaged

inspection type : sv, air turn back - after takeoff, after retraction had a gear disagree light, the landing gear disagree checklist returned to departure. no emergency was declared. adjusted the nose landing gear up and down lock sensors iaw amm 32-61-03-822-03 8. performed landing gear extension and retraction operational test iaw amm 32-32-02-705-003. all checked good.

landing gear disagree light inbound. when gear handle was put to off, gear disagree light went out and stayed out when handle was put back to up. removed and replaced nose landing gear lock actuator and lock actuator bolt iaw amm 32-34-02. adjusted the gaps on the nose landing gear uplock & downlock sensors iaw amm 32-61-03. operation check good. aircraft was grounded. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : sensor part condition : out of adjust

aircraft was grounded. during takeoff, number three tire on the right main landing gear blew. flight proceeded to san and landed without incident. removed and replaced nr 3 main landing gear tire and wheel assembly iaw amm 32-45-11. operational check good. ( closed ) nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : tire part condition : blown

gear handle jammed in up position. emergency gear extension performed landing with gear doors open. opened turtle shell for access to gear handle ( 542278 ). found gear handle in down position. performed detailed inspection of gear handle me chanism, no faults noted. checked all rig pin holes for alignment, no faults noted. swung gear numerous times with no is sues. mc & ta advised. removed and started to install landing gear control valve per md90 amm 32-31-01. completed installation of landing gear control valve ops and leak check ok. inspected cables and slanted panel, all fairleads ck. no signs of water or ice. ( 486835 ). replaced both gear door skid plates.

declared an emergency, due to the nose landing gear did not extend with lever. replaced nose landing gear sequence valve, gear did not extend during test. replaced nose landing gear lock actuator, inspected linkage cleaned flow control valve op checked normal.

aircraft was grounded : air returned to dfw. on climbout raised lng gear left gear disagree indicator light ( red ) remained illuminated with gear handle in the up position. landing gear extends normally. emergency was declared. maintenance evaluated and serviced ; flight refueled and re departed. * supplemental action sect. 4 and 5 : removed and replaced left hand main landing gear retract actuator and transfer valve iaw amm 32-94-18 and 32-31-71.

captain reported high vibration during takeoff in mex on the left inboard outboard main landing gear. at cun, maintenance personnel performed the tire tread loss or tire burst conditional inspection iaw amm 05-51-54 and ground handling equipment hits airplane or part departs airplane conditional inspection iaw amm 05-51-59, detecting main landing gear wheel and tire pos ition 02 with thrown tread and damages on left flap inboard induced by main landing gear wheel and tire position 02. the wo ´ s 5443578, 5443224 and 5443356 were issued to repair the damages detected. the main landing gear wheel and tire positions 01 and 02 were replaced iaw amm 32-45-11 and left wing aft flap inboard was replaced iaw amm task 27-51-12-000-801 and amm 27-51-12, tested co

landing green lights did not illum. when gear handle down. ran check list and got 3 green with emergency. external handle. stopper d on runway. mtc meet aircraft on runway. pinned gear and towed aircraft to gate. jacked aircraft iaw amm 07-11 swung gear 15 times. all in dication and oper. normal. remove and replace pseu per amm 32-61. checked rigging of landing gear cont. valve per amm 32-31 checked good. log 1075465. landing gear lever switch s1-89 per amm 32-62 cycled main landing gear several times. indication normal. ( lp# 5619120 )

aircraft was grounded : pilot reports gear doors caution light on upon gear extension. maintenance retracted and extended the landing gear iaw amm 32-32-00 and found that the right down lock actuator and right gear door actuator was not working properly. removed and replaced the right gear lock actuator iaw amm 32-32-02. see sdr aala201904059010.

due verification flight due to lt main landing gear unsafe light. verification of landing gear operation fails. when gear handle selec trailing edge down down got 3 green and amber door light. periscope confirmed gear down and lt door open. slowed down to 180kts - door light goes out. after shutdown left door starts opening. found crack in inner door skin at actuator attach fitting. removed lt main landing gear door iaw md90 amm 32-10 ( 252122 ). installed new lt main landing gear door per md90 amm 32-10. performed gear swings, all gear indications normal per md90 amm 32-32 ( lp5772918 )

on takeoff we received a " gear door open " alert with gear handle in the up position. also a " left gear unsafe " red light was illuminated. no sounds or vibrations noted from the cockpit or cabin crew. checklist 14.7 & 14.8 were run while tal king to maintenance and flight operations. alternate landing gear extension procedures were not utilized. during the landing, sparks were noticed on runway so the aircraft was towed back. maintenance replaced the left main landing gear door per amm 32-14. jacked ac per amm 07-11 and a gear swing was performed per amm 32-30. all gear operations are normal at this time. ( lp #4845186 )

after takeoff, placed the landing gear lever to the off position. red nose gear light illuminated and a loud noise came from nose of the aircraft. could not determine if only nose gear doors or doors and gear came down. put handle in the up position and light went out and noise went away, passing 7000 and 250kts. the aircraft was grounded. maintenance right eplaced the nose landing gear lock actuator iaw amm 32-33-21.

air turn back - unsafe gear indication on right main gear after retraction. all three green indicated when selected down. found broken spring on right main landing gear up & latch pr fox sensor linkage assembly. removed and replaced broken spring per amm 32-61-02-400 - 801. security check okay, operation check pending. accomplished landing gear retraction check per amm 32-30-00, operation check good, all indications normal.
lt main landing gear gear door has cracks on forward and aft frames near the door hinge attach points. replaced lt landing gear door.
qc detected a crack while inspecting the left main gear and the work card is calling for a gear change. replaced left main landing gear strut

inspection type : na * air turn back no emergency decld no emergency equipment used landed wout incident * landing gear would not retract after t o. gear handle would not move up. pan checklist right main landing gear still would not retract. ipc 32 37 02 01 605

after takeoff, the gear wouild not retract passed the off position. ran checklist, the gear remained down with door and disagree light luminated so we put the gear down, got normal indication and landed safely. right & right the lt main landing gear truck position actuator iaw amm 32-32-15-4, performed gear swings iaw amm 32-30-00-5-0. operation check normal, no leaks noted. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : actuator part condition : inoperative

discrepancy : at 2300z at fl240 a loud noise was heard followed by the illumination of the nose gear red light and a vibration ration after the nose gear and main landing gear green and red light came on. declared an emergency with miami and requested emergency vehicles. landed safely, fire truck inspected, the aircraft taxied to gate. corrective action : performed inspections of all three landing gear iaw amm 05-51-47 and 32-13-00. found missing bushing at left hand outer aft attach bolt. installed missing bushing iaw amm 32-13-21. performed landing gear sensor inspection and test iaw amm 32-09-00 and 32-08-02, all normal. performed landing gear lever switch inspection and check iaw amm 32-61-11, no discrepancy not
aircraft was grounded : tower reported smoke coming from left main gear area at sna after landing. maintenance removed and replaced #1 main landing gear tire iaw amm 32-45-11.

aircraft was grounded : crew declared emergency into ewr on account of nose landing gear shimmy on takeoff out of dfw. maintenance found loss of tread on right nose landing gear tire. replaced left & right nose wheel assys iaw amm 32-45-21, ok for service.

on departure at gear retraction, right main indicated unsafe ran qrh, cycled gear with no change. landed with all indicator ating safe, no future problems. with gear retracted found brake harness catching on sensor arm. indication showing red with handle up and hydraulic power applied. found broken clamp on gear strut, replaced clamp. retracted gear, indication was normal.
right main landing gear support fitting cracked

at 3000 ', 170kt indicated air speed, put gear handle down and flaps to 20 for before landing check list. nose gear did not go down ( no light ) and left hydraulic system pressure eicas with gear disagree message. complied with qrh, emergency declared. found nose gear steering pressure flex line leaking. removed and replaced nose gear steering flex pressure line. replaced nose gea right steering return flex line as precautionary. service left hydraulic system ref amm 12-12-01-3. cycled nose gear steering, operationaly checks good and leaks checks good. ok for service.

right main landing gear did not retract on takeoff. tower notify. recieved a gear disagree eicas message. gear came up at15k. removed and replaced right main gear truck positioner actuator. ops and leak check normal. gear swings normal iaw amm 32-32-15-4. aircraft ok to continue. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : actuator part condition : inoperative

ship 0915 - air turn back, gear - after takeoff the nose gear indicated red and with the associated air noise. crew suspected nose gear was still down. corrective action : maintenance found nose landing gear strut flat. the upper schrader valve replaced. the nose gear was serviced and a gear swing was performed. the aircraft was returned to service. sdr reported due to emergency being declared.

air turn back declared emergency, after vi, takeoff decision speed, high speed violent shake prior to rotation. main landing gear tire blown. right & right nr 2 main landing gear wheel assembly per amm. nature of condition : vibration buffet precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : tire part condition : blown

air turn back declared emergency, after vi, takeoff decision speed, high speed violent shake prior to rotation. main landing gear tire blown. right & right nr 1 main landing gear wheel assembly per amm. nature of condition : vibration buffet precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : tire part condition : blown

air turn back declared emergency, after takeoff and landing gear lever raised the gear indication lights showed 3 red in both the up & off position. right & right landing gear control lever module per mm.

aircraft was grounded left : nose landing gear extended with handle in off position after takeoff. putting handle back-up re tracted the nose gear. handle left in up position per qrh found landing gear selector valve fault. replaced selector valve and accomplished a satisfactory operational check per amm 32-31-51.
left main landing gear aft support fitting cracked

gear disagree gear doors after handle raised. found right gear forward drag strut actuator rod end pulled out of shaft. inspected area surrounding actuator. for damage. none noted. checked brake anti-rotation rod bolts on all main brakes. all checked good. removed and replaced right main landing gear forward gear lock actuator iaw amm 32-32-02-4. leak and ops checks good.

after takeoff, with the landing gear in the up position. the 3 main landing gear red lights would not extinguish. returned to departure. right & right the landing gear control lever module iaw amm. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : control module part condition : faulty

left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting structure side upper forward hole found corrosion. corrosion at left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting structure side upper forward hole reworked and found exceed limit as per md-11 srm 57-20-14-2r repair 1. repair bushing fabricated by machining and installed as per ea # : 1-5750-t0350145 p1 step 7. title : landing gear - anti-skid skid pkg brake - rework of the left main landing gear arb7118-7 fitting oversized hole - temperature bolt bore repair tracking. repair classified as minor per gmm 6-2-100.

crack found on forward left hand landing gear door frame. replaced lt inboard main landing gear door assembly per md88 amm 32-12. door, main landing gear, left s off 92-3210-9-0005 sn 00092. ( lp6629878 )

after takeoff, and after gear retraction, the nose landing gear red unsafe light came on, followed by a rubber burning odor. red light would stay on a few minutes and go off, then come back on until landing. declared an emergency and returned to departure without further incident. landed with three green and under max landing weight. after normal landing, maintenance installed all thee gear pins from aircraft. maintenance replaced the d1-32 nose gear locked sensor iaw amm 32-60-05, and nose gear locked wiring harness iaw swpm 20-61-00. due to odor in the cabin after takeoff, removed and replaced lt pressure regulator valve iaw amm 21-31-01. aircraft was grounded.

aircraft was grounded : on landing rollout crew felt a heavy shimmy with uncontrollable steering which resulted in the fa ilure of the nose landing gear steering system. an emergency was declared. maintenance performed a preliminary evaluation of the nose gear wheel sterring assembly and discovered the center apex pin for the torsion links was broken and had caused the torsion links to disconnect at the center attach point which caused the loss of steering of the nose landing gear. * supplemental report : replaced broken torsion link apex pin, installed new upper and lower torsion links and ac complished a satisfactory operational check per amm 32-21-31.

inspection type : na after takeoff on gear retraction got gear doors eicas message and gear door light found linkage for gear operated sequence valve broken. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : linkage part condition : broken

gear disagree message, left main did not retract after takeoff. emergency declared. complied with fim 32-30-00-815-840-001 and found side brace lock actuator rod end pulled from actuator piston. removed & replaced the side brace lock actuator on lt main landing gear iaw mm 32-32-02. operation check good, no leaks noted. swung gear iaw 32-32-00. ops normal. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : rod end part condition : failed

aircraft was not grounded. emergency declared. during flight received an left nose gear tire pressure status message. left nose gear tire pressure reads 0. removed and replaced left nose gear wheel and tire assembly iaw amm 32-45-02. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : tire part condition : leaking

aircraft was grounded, on first approach, after putting gear handle down, gear warning horn sounded, then went out. gear down indication showed three green and three red in the gear handle, three green on over-head panel. executed a, raised gear. on second approach, three green indicated as only top bottom ( normal indications ). found landing gear lever module at fault. replaced the lever module. operation check good.

after takeoff, and after gear retraction. the nose landing gear red unsafe light illuminated, followed by a rubber burn ing odor. red light would stay on a few minutes and go off, then come back on until landing. the flight declared an emer gency and returned to departure without further incident. landed with 3 green and under max landing weight. after normal landing, maintenance installed all three gear pins from aircraft. maintenance replaced d1-32 nose gear locked sensor iaw amm 32-60-05, and nose gear locked, wiring harness iaw swpm 20-61-00. also, due to odor in the cabin after takeoff, removed and replaced the lt pressure regulator valve iaw amm 21-31-01. aircraft was grounded.

aircraft was grounded. during taxi out to runway, crew reported left brake dragging. maintenance found nr 2 main landing gear wheel rubbing on nr 2 brake. removed and replaced wheel and tire assembly per amm 32-45-11. operational check good. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : return to block part name : wheel part condition : damaged

landing gear lever would not move to down position, on subsequent attempts landing gear lever did not move to down position. found cotter key on landing gear handle assembly securing lever assembly to arm assembly rubbing against nr 5 display unit. safetied cotter key and installed display unit iaw amm 31-61-03. conducted gear swing iaw amm 32-30-00. operational check okay. no rubbing landing gear lever. ok nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : other part name : cotter pin part condition : unsecure
after takeoff, crew received a landing gear indication with associated air noise. the decision was made to return to departure arture. replaced the right main landing gear sequence valve.

gear handle stuck in up position, unable to lower the gear in bet on final approach runway 19. return to anc, unable to left ower the flaps in landing in anc, until 5 mile final, then they started working again. declared emergency in anc performed emergency gear extension procedure landing was normal. upon inspection found that flap and landing gear control cab les were jammed with ice where they exit the fuselage in the main landing gear wheel well. applied heat and pressurized aircraft to right emove water for cable exit area. operational checks of systems were satisfactory.

left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting lower spot face first officer rward side found corrosion at left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting lower spot face forward side reworked as per md-11 srm 51-21-01-og. washer fabricated by mach ini ng and installed as per ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 step 8a and step 8c, title : wings - attach fittings - left main landing gear retract support frame assembly - corrosion common to bore hples and mating surfaces. repair classified as minor per gmm 6-2 - 100.refer to ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 and snrm no. n01298 for work details.

left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting lower spot face aft side found corrosion at left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting lower spot face aft side reworked as per md - 11 srm 51-21-01-og. washer fabricated by machining and installed as per ea # : 1 - 5740-t0350144 part 1 step 8a and step 8c, title : wings - attach fittings - left main landing gear retract support frame assembly - corrosion common to bore hples and mating surfaces. repair classified as minor per gmm 6-2-100.ref er to ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 and snrm no. n01298 for work details.

after takeoff, after gear retraction, the nose landing gear red unsafe light came on, followed by a rubber burning odo right. red light would stay on a few minutes and go off, then come back on until landing. declared an emergency and return ed to departure without further incident. landed with three green and under max landing weight. after normal landing, maintenance installed all three gear pins from aircraft. maintenance replaced d1-32 nose gear locked sensor iaw amm 32 - 60-05, and nose gear locked wiring harness iaw swpm 20-61-00. also, due to odor in the cabin after takeoff, removed and replaced the lt pressure regulator valve iaw amm 21-31-01. aircraft was grounded.

on climbout before gear retraction, received a level-2 tire failure with aural warning. did not retract the gear. ran qrh for level 2 tire failure. declared an emergency and returned to kewr. right & right #9 main landing gear wheel tire pressure transduc ger iaw amm 32-46-03-4 and right & right computer brake temperature monitor tire pressure indicating iaw amm 32-46-02-4 all ops checks are good no faults found at this time aircraft ok for con ' t service.

right main landing gear wheel well wing o body attach frame and main landing gear surround structure at outboard forward stop fitting upper free flange is cracked along bend radius. removed & replaced right main landing gear wheel well support channel iaw srm 51-40-02 & dwg 149n7553 rev center. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : support channel part condition : cracked

left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting upper hole spot fa ce aft side found corrosion at left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator up per attachment fitting upper hole spot face aft side reworked as per md-11 srm 51-21-01-og. washer fabricated by machi ning and installed as per ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 step 8a and step 8c, title : wings - attach fittings - left main landing gear retract support frame assembly - corrosion common to bore hples and mating surfaces. repair classified as minor per gmm 6 - 2-100.refer to ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 and snrm no. n01298 for work details.

inspection type : na * no emergency was declared - ac landed wout incident * landing gear will not retract check indicates gear trim system failed removed and replaced left hand truck beam trim cylinder iaw md11 amm 32-37-01. gear handle ope rates normally iaw fim 32-30-00-810-814

air turn back, nose gear did not retract after takeoff both red green lights illuminated on forward and upper panel on landing. the pseu light illuminated after touch down. right & right nose landing gear lock actuator iaw amm. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : actuator part condition : sheared

aircraft was grounded. emergency declared. nose landing gear light disagrees with handles. alternate gear extension successful. landing uneventful. removed and replaced nose landing gear sequence valve per amm 32-34-00. operational check good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : aborted approach part name : sequence valve part condition : faulty

status message for the landing gear monitor. no nose gear green down and locked light. followed qrh alt. extended gear still no green nose gear light. troubleshot iaw fim 32-61 ft 812, pseu faulting internal card code 010. removed and replaced pseu iaw amm 32-09-04-4, tested ok. still no nose landing gear green light indication. center light distribution unit pulled to access wires for nose landing gear light assembly iaw amm 34-22-99-4-0, all connerctors still connected. replaced center light distribution unit iaw mm 34-22-99-4-0. nose light operation check normal. nature of condition : no warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : display part condition : failed

aircraft was grounded : pilot reports after takeoff with the gear handle selected up, the nose gear extended light stayed on with the red ng light. followed qrh, gear handle remained in the up position. maintenance performed gear swing iaw amm 32-33-00. operation check was normal with no findings.

aircraft was grounded. emergency declared. dfw mia flight. landing gear disagree light illuminated before landing. completed and cycled landing gear. landing uneventful. removed and replaced landing gear control lever module assembly iaw amm 32-31-01. operational check good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : other part name : module part condition : faulty

aircraft was grounded. emergency declared. dca mia flight returned to dca account landing gear not retracting indication. uneventful landing. discovered alternate gear extension door open interfering with landing gear retraction. verified proper operation of door and switch iaw amm 32-34-00. operational check good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : door part condition : out of position

aircraft was not grounded : after takeoff, when positioned gear handle to off position, the gear door amber light illumina trailing edge down with engine indication and crew alerting system message of " gear door ". followed quick reference handbook procedure. when gear handle to up positioned, gear door light extinguished. flight continued to destination with no emergency declared. maintenance performed fault isolation manual procedure 32-30-00-0815-813, no fault found, cycled gear several time s, all indications remained normal and replaced left main landing gear door actuator as precautionary. maintenance also performed satisfactory operational checks.

flight crew aborted takeoff due to body gear steering message. aircraft returned to blocks. removed and replaced left body gear right steering actuator per amm 32-53-11. verified lock function normal.

airborne return due to gear gear door malfunction emergency declaration after takeoff gear did not indicate fully retrac trailing edge down gear door amber open light and right main red gear light complied with qrh emergency declared returned to atl. inspected and found right main landing gear follow-up torque tube assembly damaged also found skids damaged on both lt and right inboar d-door damaged inboard gear doors transferred to nr 001 and nr 002 dated 04 mar 19 removed and replaced follow-up torque tube assembly for right main landing gear replaced iaw amm 32-31 needs operation check rigged torque tube push pull cables per amm 32-31-00 page block 501 301 5 left and right sides completed adjustment of torque tube push pull cables per md 88 amm 32-31

aircraft was grounded : dfw reports nb 2 main landing gear tire blew on takeoff from ric trip 2204. main landing gear tire to blow. this caused the tread cap to separate from the tire, striking and causing damage to the left trailing edge flap and the left wing to body fairing. accomplish amm 05-51-54-210-801 for burst tire conditional inspection. accomplished burst tire inspection iaw amm 05-51-54-210 - 801. removed and replaced left inboard main flap and aft. flap iaw amm 27-51-11 and amm 27-51-12.

after takeoff, heard a loud sound as the gear was raised. during the after takeoff flow, first officer ( p. the config synoptic also showed red for the left gear. followed the qrh and brought the gear down - all green. raising the gear again per qrh lead back to all red lts for the left main. consulted mx over satcom and elected to return kind on approach, as aircraft slowed to 200k, gear unsafe lt extinguished. continued approach to uneventful landing. shgn 01may21 13 : 59 indicator u after aircraft returned to gate, the left main gear door dropped, once hydraulic pres sure was removed. upon performing the gvi of the left gear area, found door cracked around the entire perimeter of whe

left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting upper hole spot face forward side found corrosion at left hand main landing gear - left hand main landing gear retract actuator upper attachment fitting upper hole spot face forward side reworked as per md-11 srm 51-21-01-og. washer fabricated by machining and installed as per ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 step 8a and step 8c, title : wings - attach fittings - left main landing gear retract support frame assembly - corrosion common to bore hples and mating surfaces. repair classified as minor per gmm 6-2-100.refer to ea # : 1-5740-t0350144 part 1 and snrm no. n01298 for work details.

nose wheel extended after handle moved to off. ran qrh, nose wheel retracted. ref fim 32-30-00-810-809 for troubleshooting. checked pseu for maintenance messages. no current faults. no fault history. interviewed captain : shortly after starting climbout with landing gear fully retracted. co-pilot placed gear handle in the " off " position. a loud pop and air noise heard. nose gear extended fully. green nose gear light illuminated along with red light. flight crew placed gear handle back to the " up " position. nose gear retracted and normal indications. flight crew reports never exceeding 250 knots during this event. crew reported snow & amperage ; slushy conditions on taxi out. crew executed qrh procedur

put landing gear handle down to land. loud bang and aircraft shudder. right hydraulics lost. ran qrh procedures and landed. found right bottle pin broke. replaced bottle pin per md88 amm 57-40-02 and replaced right main landing gear retract actuator per md88 amm 32-32-02. leak check and ops good. cycled main landing gear several times with no defects noted.

after takeoff the landing gear handle would not raise to retract. ran qrh. landing gear retracted with lock override q right. removed and replaced left forward main gear truck tilt sensor iaw amm 32-09-07-2. operation check good. aircraft ok for service. sdr info : part name sensor, proximity switch system, part number 8-935-01fs, and serial number - 0785.

inspection type : na * air turn back - no emergency decl ' d-landed wno incident ac taken oos * after gear handle raised eicas msgs gear tilt & gear door synoptic showed left inbd body gear amber tilt & door not closed, gear door message intermittent for 5 min, then showed closed speed maintained below 250 knots indicated air speed gear.

on approach to runway 27 kmem, when landing gear selected down, the left gear down green light did not illuminate. declared an emergency with kmem air traffic control, made low pass to allow tower to visually verify all gear normal. normal landing after verifying gear down with tower. upon crew debrief found that the lt gear down switch light was burned out and would not test. relamped lt gear down locked light iaw amm 33-13-00-2. light illuminated and operation check good. as precaution vis ually inspected down lock sensors on main and nose gear, also performed built in test equipment test of pseu and found no discrepancies iaw fim 32-09 ft804 fig 103. aircraft has no 30 day history and is ok to continue service at this time.
right main landing gear support beam fuse pin found cracked.

inspection type : 2c lt main landing gear wheel well forward side of strut cutout door landing angle is cracked. replaced cracked angle on lt main landing gear wheel well forward side of strut cutout door landing, iaw srm 51-35-01. ( minor )

landing gear lever does not move to the up position in-flight, is free to move to the up position when the lock override is used. emergency declared. pseu built in test equipment check indicated ground spoiler interlock valve failure. installed ground spoiler interlock iaw 27-62-61-400-801. operation check good. jacked aircraft iaw amm 07-11-01-580-815, and performed the landing gear control system test iaw amm 32-31-00-730-802. performed gear swing. landing gear lever ops normal. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : interlock valve part condition : faulty

aircraft grounded. during takeoff roll experienced nose gear shimmy. departure control advised that tire debri was reported on runway. after landing inspection of nose gear shows right nose tire tread shed. both nose tires removed and replaced iaw amm 32-45-02.

after lowering gear handle, the right gear did not show down with gear disagree message. lights checked normal, came down with alternate gear extension. no emergency was declared and the flight landed without further incident. the aircraft was grounded. found a hydraulic leak on the right gear truck positioner pressure line. replaced the line iaw amm 20 - 10-10.

the aircraft was grounded. nose gear fail to retract on with gear handle up. red on forward panel - no lights onoh panel. the flight declared an emergency, proceeded with, and landed without further incident. maintenance replaced nose landing gear lock actuator iaw amm 32-33-21. ( see also sdr aala20170601008 ) nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : aborted approach part name : actuator part condition : faulty

aircraft was grounded. emergency declared. slc ord flight returned to slc account landing gear would not retract. overweight landing uneventful. accomplished general visual inspection. cleaned proximity switches. checked operation of limit switches. verified operation of the landing gear selector valve. cycled landing gear 4 times. operational check good per amm 32-32-00. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : unknown part condition : malfunctioned

found fire extinguisher wedged in the right inboard landing gear truck between the nr 9 and 10 main landing tires. this caused the eicas warning config stabilizer on takeoff. the fire extinguisher rubbed the inboard side liner of each nr 9 and10 main landing gear tires. removed the fire extinguisher. performed conditional inspections iaw amm 05-51-58, and 05-51-25. aircraft returned to service. nature of condition : first officer. precautionary procedure : return to block part name : landing gear part condition : foreign object debris
left wing aft support fitting for the main landing gear beam is cracked

after takeoff, landing gear didn ' t retract. returned for landing. found tilt actuator missing a bearing, pin worn and proximity switch bracket cracked. replaced the proximity switch bracket and main landing gear tilt actuator. system operation is normal. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : bracket part condition : cracked

aircraft was grounded. on final approach after gear extension, gear doors eicas message and gear door light illuminated. removed and replaced right downlock operated door sequence valve for the right main landing gear iaw amm 32-32-07.operational check good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : none part name : sequence valve part condition : faulty

during high frequency eddy current surface inspection on the left hand nose landing gear trunnion fitting aft of nose landing gear door aft hinge fitting slot out area and found 02 each cracks with length approximately 0.250 " station 583 left hand nose landing gear trunnion fitting station 583 repair carried out as per ea 1-5310-t0312182 a part 3. title : fuselage - main frame - left nose landing gear trunion fitting crack inspection. repair classified as major per gmm 6-2-100.

when gear was retracted initially showed left main gear unsafe on both gear light and config page. after qrh procedure s, we then had left and right main gear unsafe. during cruise. repalaced lower trapezoid fitting bushing on left door ref md 11 mm 32-14-20-4 did not break into rig or make any adjustments to the door swung gear times had no faults operation check good.

did not receive an up & locked indication on the right main gear after takeoff on both primary & secondary display. ran the checklist, cycled the gear, good down and locked, negative right main up and locked. felt a slight vibration at 16k, 230 knots with gear handle up. landing uneventful. removed right main landing gear door link. found bolt siezed into float bushing. after right emoval cleaned entire area. hat bushings found serviceable. replaced the bolt and float bushing and reinstalled right main landing gear door link. spring pressure now pulls door uplock link firmly back every time. iaw amm 32-34-05-4. also iaw tsi 32-607 388, changed right gear door uplock sensor d1-80. iaw 32-61-15-4. performed gap checks of link and bracket assembly iaw amm

on taxi to runway 25 kden upon reaching runway we received a level 2 brake overheat warning. stopped aircraft and detrmin ed the #6 tire brake indicated 650c all other brakes indicated 300 or less. we only used right brake and allowed trailing edge mp to drop to 550c and attempted to taxi back to ramp. after a short taxi not using left brake it started to climb again. stopped ac. brake indicated 750c we then had a level 2 tire " failure " removed and replaced #6 main landing gear tire and wheel assembly iaw md amm 11 32-41-01-4. wri 32-432349 removed and replaced #6 brake assembly iaw md11 amm 11 32-43-20-4 ops and leak check good.

aircraft was grounded : flight air returned to rno on account of reported blown tire on takeoff. emergency was declared ; landed without incident. maintenance replaced both main gear tires and brakes in right landing gear iaw amm 32-41-41 & 32-4 5-11 iaw amm 32-41-41.

left hydraulic system pressure light illuminated on final after landing gear down and locked and flaps at final configuration. follow ed by left hydraulic system pressure and left yaw damper. cleared runway after landing - maintenance tow to gate. removed and replaced defective flex hose on left main landing gear downlock actuator left main landing gear downlock actuator op ' s ck ' d good. no leaks noted. aircraft ok for flight. flex hose mpn 271n6119-1 no serial number.
left wing landing gear support beam fuse pin found to be corroded.

left main landing gear beam retract actuator link pivot shaft aft end has circumferential cracked. removed and replaced the left main landing gear beam retract actuator link pivot shaft, reference 32-32-01-4 nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : pivot part condition : cracked

the aircraft was grounded. nose gear fail to retract on with gear handle up. red on forward panel - no lights onoh panel. the flight declared an emergency, proceeded with, and landed without further incident. maintenance replaced the nose landing gear transfer cylinder iaw amm 32-33-41. ( see also sdr aala201706049001 ) nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : aborted approach part name : cylinder part condition : faulty

aircraft was grounded. experienced gear related vibration above 100 knots on to and landing. upon taxi in, experienced second left main failure both left gear tires flat reported by another aircraft. flight crew also reported aproximatley 30 minutes after sitting with the left main gear tires flat they experienced a loss of hydraulic quantity on the left hand side. maintenance main found the hydraulic line to the left gear shimmy damper severed. maintenance replaced the sever ed hydraulic line, bled the shimmy damper and accomplished a satisfactory leak check, per amm 32-11-81. ( aala2020111290 22 ) in addition, left hand main landing gear nr 1 ( aala202011019005 ) and nr 2 ( aala202011129021 ) tires were replaced, pe

during inspection maintenance found crack of 0.093 " on box support assembly of the aileron trim actuator attachment lug at left h main landing gear wheel well. box support assembly of the aileron trim actuator attachment lug at left main landing gear wheel well was repaired era 590462-14. ( lp 1748160 )

( air turn back ) returned to atl due to gear disagree message during gear up selection with an associated gear warning light. crew completed qrh procedure and declared an emergency with air traffic control. gear extension resulted in normal gear down indication. replaced gear operated sequence valve, leak and op cks good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : none part name : sequence valve part condition : malfunctioned

aircraft was grounded. emergency declared. lax ord flight returned to lax account landing gear would not retract. overweight landing uneventful. repeat item. removed and replaced the landing gear lever module per amm 32-31-11 and the proximity switch electronics unit per amm 32-09-10 ( aala201708249021 ). operational check good. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : module part condition : faulty

the aircraft was not grounded. during climb, status message tire pressure synoptic shows left nose 0 pounds per square inch. the flight continued to dfw, but declared an emergency for landing. the flight landed without further incident. per amm 32-45-02, removed & replaced left nose wheel & tire assembly due to leak, and right nose wheel & tire assembly due to left nose gear wheel being flat, no faults. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : none part name : tire part condition : leaking

aircraft was grounded. amber main landing gear tire pressure reading 158 pounds per square inch to 165 pounds per square inch. while on approach to dfw, the flight declared an emergency. the flight landed without further incident. main landing gear tire pressure returned to normal after landing. removed and replaced nr 11 tire per amm 32-45-02. operational check good. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : none part name : tire part condition : low pressure

crack on right beam cut out sta y=47 nose landing gear wheel well ( nose landing gear ). damage area was repaired per era 560906-14 rev original. ( et ) ( hfec ) was accomplished per ndt spm 06-10-01.001 no cracks were found after removed damage on right beam cut out sta y=47 nose landing gear wheel well. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : beam part condition : cracked

left gear would not extend normally. diverted & declared an emergency. right & right the main landing gear uplock actuator iaw amm. nature of condition : warning indication precautionary procedure : unsched landing part name : actuator part condition : faulty
right wing landing gear support beam fuse pin was corroded.

right main landing gear landing gear forward trunnion support fitting corroded. repaired fitting per ea. nature of condition : other precautionary procedure : none part name : support fitting part condition : corroded
